title.narrative: PUBLIC FINANCE FOR CHILDREN-PF4C

description.narrative: By 2020, strengthened transparency, accountability and social oversight of national plans and budgets for inclusive social policies, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: All children benefit from evidence based social and economic policies that address multi-dimensional poverty and advance the equitable realization of their rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, strengthened transparency, accountability and social oversight of national plans and budgets for inclusive social policies

description.narrative: UNICEF engaged into intensive advocacy efforts to ensure Children's Agenda as a priority for next government's development plan. The results were tangible as key asks were included to all main partiesparties' manifestos. UNICEF formed a strategic partnership with MEF-CEDSIF (Centro de Desenvolvimento de Sistemas de Informação de Finanças) ensuring that the key programmes of new programme-based planning and budgeting system include relevant structure and indicators for children. Budget analyses was well welcomed by MINEDH (Ministry of Education) leading to a dialogue how to better target root causes of school dropout also from planning and budgeting point of view. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2020

title.narrative: 2.5 Public spending on social protection from domestic resources as a proportion of national budget
Open Budget Index
3.2 Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children

Information and reports on child-focused public expenditures (by sector and sub-sector) is available by governments, sectors are health, nutrition, child protection, social protection, WASH and education
